title.narrative: Joint DAC - UNDP SIDS Financing Project

description.narrative: The Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development's (OECD) Development Assistance Committee (DAC) and United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) are cooperating in a joint project to enhance understanding about the financing challenges, options and opportunities facing different types of Small Island Developing States (SIDS). At the 2014 United Nations SIDS conference in Samoa, UNDP and the DAC Chair agreed that their respective organisations would work together on a new initiative to assess the special financing needs of SIDS. The DAC side of the partnership is focused on the implications SIDS' particular financing needs have for donor practices in working with this group of partner countries. The UNDP research is focused on SIDS' perspectives regarding criteria for allocating concessional finance and innovative financial instruments that could expand their development financing options. Funding under this investment supports the work undertaken by the OECD and UNDP and is
